definitions: To depart from the ground, as an aircraft or bird.
To achieve sudden success or popularity.
To mimic or imitate someone or something.
To have a period of time away from work or duties.
examples: Please take off your shoes at the door.
The plane will take off in ten minutes.
He had to take off when he heard the news.
Her new business really took off.
He can take off his boss perfectly.
I'm taking off next week for vacation.
